div.p: From Frederick Bailey to Charles Moore
Notebook, Colonial Botanist, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.
Item is a notebook entry marked 'Copy of part of Letter to C. Moore Esq'. P.S.

There is another matter also I should like to ask you about. I feel that a change would be beneficial to me, and should therefore like to know whether there is any likelihood of your government carrying out the idea of attaching a botanical herbarium and museum to your department
i.e. the Sydney Botanic Garden. You will remember you some time ago wrote me on the subject In the event of such a useful work being begun I offer myself a curator as to my fitness to occupy such a position Baron Mueller or the Rev J E Tenison Woods might be written to but such perhaps would be needless as I have been so much connected with Australian botany for many years past. I am not greedy of salary but love my profession and would be willing to commence with my present 250 a year — hoping you will bring this before the authorities I remain
